analytic.title: Nature in Ǧibrīl b. Nūḥ al-Anbārī’s Kitāb al-I‘tibār fī l-malakūt

biblStruct.note: This short Christian Arabic text, written about 830 CE, is a collection of teleological proofs of God’s existence (arguments from design). It is mostly about nature, since in nature both God’s existence and his management of his creation become manifest. The text is a link in the chain of transmission of ancient physiologists (aṣḥāb al-ṭabāʾiʿ). It stands in a long tradition of Aristotle, Xenophon, Cicero, Pliny and Galen, but also Christian authors: the Physiologus, Theodoret, Basil, Jacob of Edessa, and in general the Hexaëmeron literature.
